c74object.name: vlog~
c74object.description:
vlog~ provides a CPU efficient version of log~ using SIMD operations.
Use the vlog~ object to output a signal composed of the logarithms of its input values. You can specify the logarithmic base.

objarg.name: logarithmic-base
objarg.description: Sets the base of the logarithm. The default value is 0.

method.name: float
method.digest: Set the base of the logarithm
method.description: In right inlet: Sets the base of the logarithm. The default is 0, which is equivalent to the natural logarithm (log to the base e, or 2.71828182). log to the base of 1 is always 0.

method.name: signal
method.description: In left inlet: vlog~ sends out a signal that is the logarithm of the input signal, to the base specified by the typed-in argument or the value most recently received in the right inlet. If a value in the signal is less than or equal to 0, vlog~ sends out a value of 0.00000001.

entry.name: signal
entry.description: The logarithm of the input signal to the base specified by the initial argument or the value most recently received in the right inlet.
